clinical_study.brief_title: PCORI-CER-1306-03385 Informed Decisions About Lung Cancer Screening
clinical_study.official_title: Promoting Informed Decisions About Lung Cancer Screening: Randomized Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Educational research study where goal is to test educational materials that help people make informed decisions about lung cancer screening.

detailed_description.textblock: This is second phase of a larger project funded by the Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute to help heavy smokers make informed decisions about lung cancer screening with low-dose computed tomography (LDCT). The aim of this phase is to compare outcomes for promoting informed screening decisions about lung cancer screening in a randomized trial of patients who smoke recruited through state-based smoking cessation quitlines, where patients will be randomly assigned to the updated patient decision aid or to standard educational materials on lung cancer screening.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Value Subscale (VS) Score of Decisional Conflict Scale (DCS)
primary_outcome.description: DCS measures personal perceptions using survey response categories. DCS Value Subscale includes a designated number of associated survey items which are scored according to response categories (3 -5 responses, i.e. 0='Yes'; 2='Not Sure'; 4='No'). Total scores will range from 0 [feels extremely clear about personal value for benefits & risks/side effects] to 100 [feels extremely unclear about personal values]. For scores or subscores reported as sum of items that used response category scale [ranging from low decisional conflict to high decisional conflict] scores will be converted to equivalent 0-100 scale. Knowledge outcome assessed at week 1 then 3-month and 6-month follow-up (overall participation 6 months).

For scores or subscores reported as sum of items that used response category scale [ranging from low decisional conflict to high decisional conflict] scores will be converted to equivalent 0-100 scale. criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Men and women 55 to 77 years of age.
2. Participants must speak English.
3. Current smoker or quit smoking within the past 15 years.
4. At least a 30 pack-year smoking history.
Exclusion Criteria:
1) History of lung cancer.
